title: How to Show & Highlight the Max Values in an Excel Graph

steps.title: Open your project in Excel.
steps.content: Open your project in Excel. If you're in Excel, you can go to File > Open or you can right-click the file in your file browser.

steps.title: Create a line graph with your data
steps.content: Create a line graph with your data . You'll need to create a line graph for this method to work. To do this, select your data, then go to Insert > Line Graph icon > Line with Markers . It's the line graph with dots.

steps.title: Create a new column next to your data set labeled "Max.
steps.content: Create a new column next to your data set labeled "Max. " Since this information will be included in the line graph, keep it close to your original data set so you can easily add it to the data range represented by the graph.

steps.title: Enter the following formula:
steps.content: Enter the following formula: =IF(B5=MAX($B$5:$B$16),B5,””) . In this example, B5 represents the first cell in your range, while B16 represents the last. Replace these cell addresses with the actual cells in your data. This formula will make the highest value in your dataset repeat in this new column, but none of the other values will appear. Fill the rest of the column with that formula and you'll see the highest value in your data set repeats in that column.

steps.title: Add the "Max" column to your chart.
steps.content: Add the "Max" column to your chart. Click your chart to select it, then drag the box highlighting the data it's representing to include the extra column. [1] X Research source
